TopicTitle: This imgur album should never die

Articles.Content:
Early planets, as documented by our very own NovaSilisko!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

(shamelessly reposted from an olden blog by him)
Very nice!

Nice find!

I remmeber reading about a crystal moon around Eve in one of the ancient threads, never knew why it was pulled until now though.
Aww, I liked the crystal moon. It could be a moon of Eeloo(Charon analogue?).
I remember some of these pics. I feel old.
Hehe, I was around when he threw these around for the first time. Everyone was so terribly excited, ehehe. I just remember hoping that the weird crystal planet could come back at some point...

Aww, I liked the crystal moon. It could be a moon of Eeloo(Charon analogue?).

I don't think there are plans for moons to have moons.
Probably not, but it is certainly something the game engine is capable of handling.
They already have had a moon of a moon, remember the magic boulder?
Hope the crystal moon makes a return.
there has got to be at least one moon with a moon. The final planetary system should have a little bit of everything.

I remember this!

Also, I just realized: why is the Mk1 Pod in most of the pics? I guess this was all in .15...

That's cool seeing some of the original ideas.

A moon with a moon would be cool, but now all I can think of is moon moon.

there has got to be at least one moon with a moon. The final planetary system should have a little bit of everything.

I guess the problem with a (dammit) moon moon is that it's not very stable in real life. If you go on universe sandbox and place small but still reasonably sized object in orbit above the moon, unless it is very low, if will slowly be pulled in by the earth and end up hitting the moon, or escaping into an earth orbit

I found this when i was a forum lurker

I like the crystal moon also the old sun.
I want all these planets back, especially a crystal moon
I want to have planetary collisions. Those are always fun.

Actually an unstable moon moon would be really cool. Two have two moons that after a given time would wipe each other out (in true moon moon style) would be a nice feature. If the collision event happens quite early on in the games timeline it would be a nice challenge to get to them and leave again while it was still safe (which should be worth a boat-load of science) or to be present (at a safe distance) when they do eventually go phut (which should also be worth quite a bit of science).

I can see that it would not be easy to implement as it would need to result in a) some colossal explosion animation, a resultant asteroid belt and c) a change to some nearby orbits. But all of those things would be awesome!

I can see that it would not be easy to implement as it would need to result in a) some colossal explosion animation, a resultant asteroid belt and c) a change to some nearby orbits. But all of those things would be awesome!

d) Either core-melting render distance or exclusive constant rendering of Moon Moon.
I'm going to go out on a limb here and say that planetary collisions in ksp will never ever ever happen ever. I'd say there's a greater likelihood of squad adding dinosaurs on Laythe.

I'm going to go out on a limb here and say that planetary collisions in ksp will never ever ever happen ever. I'd say there's a greater likelihood of squad adding dinosaurs on Laythe.

Or aliens.

They already have had a moon of a moon, remember the magic boulder?

*had

I remember this album, I think Nova said the project has been abandoned a long time ago, so no crystal moon. It would be a much-welcomed addition, though.
Those are so cool! Someone should make a mod that adds these planets/moons.

Or aliens.

Or Multiplayer!

Oh wait...

They already have had a moon of a moon, remember the magic boulder?

On subject though, I like Eve's original crystal covered moon idea... Or the not so purple terrain of Eve.
